vignette.name: Ease Package Overview
vignette.p: The Ease package is a collection of objects for applying easing functions as formalized and popularized by Robert Penner. The Ease package provides objects and examples covering control streams, audio streams, matrix applications, open gl geometry and scene automation, as well as applications for audio in gen~.

ul.li: ease - Apply easing functions to numbers in Max, with optional scaling.
ease~ - Apply easing functions to audio signals, with optional scaling.
list.ease - Apply easing functions to each element of a list, with optional scaling.
jit.ease - Apply easing functions to each cell of a matrix, with optional scaling.
ease.xfade - Use an easing function to interpolate between successive lists.
ease.xfade~ - Use an easing function to interpolate between two samples at audio rate.
ease.animation_example.maxpat - Animated OpenGL geometry and audio synthesis.
ease.per_multiple_example.maxpat - Integration of jit.ease, multiple geometry and jit.gen.
ease.synth_example.maxpat - Polyphonic synth with easing applied to envelopes.
ease.gen.codebox_example.maxpat - Demonstrate how to call the easing functions from a codebox in gen~.
ease.gen.comparison.maxpat - Visual comparison running all easing functions in individual gen~ instances.
